DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the present study is to assess whether the application of a new hydrocellular polyurethane foam multilayer dressing shaped for the sacral area (MSP) in addition to standard care reduces the rate of pressure sores (PU) and their severity especially in the elderly population admitted for fragility Hip Fractures.
DOC.brief_title: Polyurethane Foam on the Sacrum for Prevention
DOC.criteria: Patients aged ≥ 65 years with Hip fragility fracture without National Pressure Ulcers Advisory Panel scale (NPUAP) scale grade ≥ II PU Patients or legal guardians who give their consent to take part in the study Exclusion Criteria Patients with known allergy to the product being tested or dermatological diseases that prevent the use of topical products Patients with periprosthetic or pathological fractures Patients with diaphyseal or distal femoral fractures
